website_summaries.verdict: A simple, single compartment bag that provides quick, easy access to treats.
pros: Drawstring makes it easy to open and close
Attaches to belt loop with included clip
Sits at an affordable price point
Made from durable double-enforced material to keep treats dry
cons: Available in black, blue, or red but no guarantee on which color you will receive

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need to carry training treats!
customer_reviews.text: When I walk my lab puppy, I always wear a fanny pack to carry my cell, hand sanitizer, extra roll of poo bags, and a grocery sack to carry the bagged poo. This treat bag fits on the strap of my pack perfectly! I’m happy I don’t have to carry the training treats in a pocket anymore. The closure is tight-fitting, but I keep it open just enough to fit my hand in to grab some treats. It doesn’t tip or flip over, so no worries of spilling treats, and it’s the perfect size...not too big, not too small! It’s sturdy canvas (canvas-like?) material. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Deb M.

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bag that would hold enough treats and would be able to easily be wearable and not fall off like other do. This one is just snap on and off I’d go. It’s able to hold big treats as well. Easily cleanable, I’d just flip inside out and wash it with water and soap or a cleaning wipe if they were dry treats. My dog would see the bad and know it’s tear time. Not expensive and works for when you have training or just want to carry around some treats
customer_reviews.author: Scarlet Maria

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I found the 2 cup size as I have big hands. This tote is big enough for me to reach down to the bottom of the tote to grab the remaking treats. My only complaint is that the bag does not close all the way. So if I fill up to the level where the drawstring is at the some of the treats fall. Other than that you can’t go wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheap little treat pouch
customer_reviews.text: I got this because it was the cheapest one I could find while still being the shape I wanted. I've not been disappointed. It serves its purpose well; clips to my belt or tucks easily into my coat pocket so I can carry wet treats without yucking up my pocket, ties shut when I need it to, and doesn't have a whole bunch of extra parts hanging off of it. Simple, cheap and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Pegasene

customer_reviews.title: Great totes for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these bags, so much so that any time one dies or I adopt a new dog I buy a new one! They clip on so easily, hold the perfect amount of treats for training out and about, and the closure is fairly secure! One star off because after just a month of use the string on my first one started to wrinkle, then split up, and I had to start cutting off the random strings that would hang off. Otherwise I love these! Really wish I could choose the color, though.
customer_reviews.author: SQuigley

customer_reviews.title: Great for Training
customer_reviews.text: Great for training, exactly what is needed. You don't get to choose the color and have to live with what they send you but training with your dog is not exactly a black tie event. The large holds a lot of treats so you don't need to reload so often but isn't like a cumbersome bucket on your hip. The clip on the back works great in the waistband of your pants or in your pocket. Has a drawstring to "close" for more vigorous activities however I don't use this function. Very glad I found this and as always, amazon prices blow away the higher prices at pet stores.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper X

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the money. Holds plenty of goodies for a training session and is built well. I bought 2 and have been using them for a few months now without any issues. I don't see how the people in other reviews and breaking the string unless they are not fully pressing the release button on the string lock. Mine aren't frayed in the least and look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: DisKid

customer_reviews.title: Great, cheap, usable tool for dog training
customer_reviews.text: Great size and clips into yoga pants, pockets, and belt loops. I got the largest size. It carries about enough treats for 15ish minutes of training with constant treating. Good for those looking for something to hold treats in besides ziplock baggies. It's easy to clean and wash. I used this for my reactive dog training class with hot dogs and warm (read wet) chicken meat, and a quick rinse makes it good as new. I only use the pull string day to day fairly loosely, to keep treats from tumbling out. I don't pull it too tight unless the bag is really full, as it keeps me from being able to stick my hands in the bag at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR DOG TRAINING!
customer_reviews.text: WE WERE TOLD BY OUR DOG TRAINER TO BUY THIS. WE DID. IT WORKED OUT REAL WELL IN THE TRAINING CLASS. IT HOLDS THE RIGHT AMOUNT OF TREATS. IT ATTACHES TO YOUR BELT FOR EASY ACCESS. IT CLOSES TIGHT ALSO. EVERY ONE HAD ONE. EVERYONE LIKED THEM TOO!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use at my dog training class. I like that I don’t have to wear a belt all the way around my waist and I can just hook it to my waist band. It’s a good size and the drawstring helps keep the treats fresh. It’s also affordable . I would not get a smaller size though because I think it would be too small to get your hand in.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, cost effective treat pouch that works much better than stuffing your pockets full of treats. The drawstring allows you to adjust the opening, so it's great for the winter when your fingers are bigger because of gloves. You can also close it completely so remaining treats do not dry out. It easily clips to any pocket on your coat or jeans, and it hasn't spilled treats or fallen off yet, but our exercise consists mostly of walks and playing fetch. If you need to clean it, it would probably be fine in the washing machine. If you want to keep stinky treats out of your pockets, try one of these.
customer_reviews.author: LillithTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY...
customer_reviews.text: Garbage... pull string on the pouch only closes half of the pouch. Any time i bend down i have to worry about treats falling out. I would NEVER buy this again or recommend this product to anyone. it lasted a good 10 minutes before i took it off and tossed the pouch. The training session turned into a walk to the pet store to buy a new pouch. Do your self a favor, spend a little more an a product that actually does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly durable!
customer_reviews.text: My 105lb dog got access to it and bit it and it was soggy when I found her trying to get into it and it was still 100% intact and the closure to keep the treats fresh and contained was not even opened a single bit! Just soggy and completely powdered treats from the chewing. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Cinna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for training and walks
customer_reviews.text: We needed a quick and easy way to reward our puppy for using the bathroom outside because plastic bags filled with treats in our pocket just weren't cutting it. This pouch has been a great alternative! We just clip it to our pants before heading out the door, and accessing the treats inside is extremely quick and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots better that the one that clamps shut.
customer_reviews.text: I got this one on the recommendation of my daughter in law who is a puppy trainer for Guiding Eyes, who train puppies to go into the Seeing Eyes program. It's much easier to use than the one that clamps shut; it easier to get your hand into. It cleans well and is easy to put on your clothing also.
customer_reviews.author: ragsdoll

customer_reviews.title: Definite buy
customer_reviews.text: Well made, easy to clean, durable. Do not buy the 1 cup version if you do more than gentle walking as treats will pop out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Best puppy supplies purchase
customer_reviews.text: This treat pouch is one of the best supplies we bought for our puppy. The pouch easily hangs off your waistband, and there is a string to cinch it so the treats don’t spill out. Works better than the fanny pack I originally bought to carry training treats.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy treat holder
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product to carry my dog’s treats. It has a sturdy clip to clip on a belt or whatever (I clip it to my purse usually) and a strong drawstring to close it. I haven’t tried cleaning it yet but it looks like it would be easy to flip inside out and wipe off.
customer_reviews.author: Rocknerd

customer_reviews.title: Drawstring Failed due to Low Quality Cord
customer_reviews.text: This treat pouch is a good idea, poorly implemented. The bag comes with a drawstring to close the top, that opens and closes by a spring-loaded plastic clip (such as can be seen on many camping/outdoor items). Unfortunately, the cord supplied is loosely woven, with the result that it soon frayed -- and ultimately broke -- from use.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Holmes, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I ended up with the Blue color, which I was very happy about. The quality of this holder is great and fits more than enough treats. (I ordered the larger size). the tie is well built and keeps everything neatly inside, I also keep my dogs training clicker inside the pouch with the treats.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Effective design, perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just perfect. I mean, my hands get a little greasy and crumby from the kibble, but that's the nature of the beast. I really like the drawstring, and have not had any problems with losing it inside the bag. I got black, which I'm happy about. The clip works really well on jeans, belts, skirts, yoga pants, etc. This method of treating with food has made my dog much more responsive to me and he gets to have fun all day. He is especially obedient when I'm wearing the treat tote!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Great size for small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a tote bag for small treat or a few large treats this is perfect. I appreciate the ability to leave it open, keep it shut or best yet the ability to tighten it but easily get my hand in to retrieve some treats. Easily clips to your waistline or pocket. This will hold a nearly unlimited supply of Zuke size treats. This was one of the best training tools we purchased and I'd recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: C. Medenwaldt

customer_reviews.title: Size that fits
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a treat bag that was dedicated to that function. I wanted to be able to easily reach treats when training my dog. This bag does this. It easily fits on my waist and has an adjustable closure so treats don't fall out when I bend over. This bag fits all my training needs. This is a single function bag.
customer_reviews.author: SB Damico

customer_reviews.title: Great for training on the go
customer_reviews.text: I really like this treat holder. I especially like the clip. You can just clip it on to your pants and go. I use it on walks, in training class, etc. I got the two cup size. I doubt I would have been able to get my hand into the one cup size
customer_reviews.author: Meganmh

customer_reviews.title: Sent wrong color
customer_reviews.text: Product is very good and fast delivery can’t take anything away from that. Quality of material is strong and holds lots of treats. The clip is good and it also has a belt loop. The only thing that annoyed me was I specifically asked for a black one and they still sent me a red one.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: so handy!
customer_reviews.text: Love to have this on our walks or teaching him new tricks. My pockets don't get so crumbly & I don't accidentally wash treats. When he sees us put it on he gets pretty happy! Good things are coming!
customer_reviews.author: Emily J. Helm

customer_reviews.title: Working out well
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised and is holding up well 7 months in and counting. We are working our now 10 month old Golden Retriever puppy pretty hard with training and classes. Puppy has a bit of a stubborn streak so I almost always have a tote full of treats so positive reinforcement is readily available.
customer_reviews.author: A. Elizabeth Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy to Take on Walks
customer_reviews.text: Makes going out with my dogs very convenient. I keep treats and bags inside, so I can grab and go after leashing up my dogs and know I have what I need. The clip is sturdy and stays on my waist band, and I’ve occasionally carried it as well when I’m wearing a dress and have nothing to clip it to. The larger size can fit a large tennis ball too!
customer_reviews.author: DTD

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. It is durable and easy to clean. The one downside is that the clip that hooks it to you is a little scratchy, which can be uncomfortable when walking a longer distance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for potty training and it serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of this! Haven’t had ton of issues with it either. It latches onto my leash well. It really is just a chalk bag repurposed for treats. It’s small and easy to carry so that’s all I care about.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for dog training!
customer_reviews.text: Did puppy training classes and this worked GREAT! Loved it! Made life so much easier during class because you have to grab a treat quickly and it is just right there
customer_reviews.author: Henry Compton

customer_reviews.title: Great treat bag
customer_reviews.text: I love this for training our lab puppy. Works great to have treats readily available for positive reinforcement. I use this every time I take our dog out. I would recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Fly Creek Quilter

customer_reviews.title: Great for training!
customer_reviews.text: Having worked with dogs for over 15 years, I can't believe it has taken me this long to purchase a clip on treat tote! They are super convenient and awesome for training. I like the positioning of the clip I work with several large breed dogs. The other treat tote that I have kind of hangs down and it is much easier for the dogs to get into! These would make a great gift for anyone with a new dog.
customer_reviews.author: Katie C

customer_reviews.title: Easy Schmeezy
customer_reviews.text: This makes giving treats during training so much easier. I am moving around while training and I do not have to keep stopping to try and get treats out of my pocket anymore. If you are working with a running dog and need to get to them quickly this is an easy way to reward without delay.
customer_reviews.author: CLP in Mossyrock WA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The only way to handle treats, no mess in the pockets. Easy to clip on and east to access. I just wish they would make one a bit larger. I have large hands and even the 2 cup bag is a bit tight to get my hand into.
customer_reviews.author: CaptBarrel

customer_reviews.title: excellent pouch
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday to help with training my Golden Retriever puppy. It's the perfect size, easy to bring along, and the clip is perfect to hang on your clothes for handsfree training.
customer_reviews.author: Billy12345

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase
customer_reviews.text: It works fine for me. A little smaller than I expected but it will make me keep the treats fresher. The belt clip was easily removed so I can use a carabiner to attach it to my belt bag. Overall a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Phrede

customer_reviews.title: My hands are too big for this
customer_reviews.text: 2 Cup size: Bag is too deep and narrow for my hands. I’d have to fill it to the top to easily get at the treats. Now, I have to dig down and my hands get stuck trying to come out. It probably works fine for smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Durable and perfect for training!
customer_reviews.text: We purchases a couple of these to keep on us for our agility classes. They stay securely hooked on all pants - leggings, athletic shorts, jeans, etc. I love how easy they are to clean and how many treats I can fit inside! The drawstring is tight and there have been no spills while running with it on!
customer_reviews.author: Callie Maxey

customer_reviews.title: Great for training our dog
customer_reviews.text: So far this seems great. We are using it for training class. Holds plenty of treats to get us through 1 or even 2 classes for my 65+lb lab mix. Seem well made and the treats dont fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Handley Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great treat bag, easy to clean, wish it was magnetic
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great for training and walking. I feed my dog premium, refrigerated treats, so I find the bag gets dirty and needs to be cleaned about once a week. Cleaning the bag is pretty easy though: just turn the bag inside out, run it under warm water, and let it dry. You won't need to do this is your treats are dry (e.g., dog biscuits). The cord at the top is a little difficult to operate one-handed, so I kind of wish it was magnetic instead. Other than that minor complaint, this is a great treat bag.
customer_reviews.author: William Brendel

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Simple and small, sturdy plastic clip for your pants or belt. Easily fits in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: DEANNA JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog training!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to carry treats for dog training, made it through from beginners to advanced with no issues! I would absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea S.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this pouch. Easy to get treats in and out but I should've got a bigger size for my labradoodle lol! At first he kept trying to tug at it but if I keep it closed he's good
customer_reviews.author: MAvalos

customer_reviews.title: If only they had sent Red....
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a red one. I received a black one. Which is fine... I just wanted red... It still functions exactly as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Linds23

customer_reviews.title: Great treat pouch for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great but drags down my pants! Wish there were a way to wear around my neck. Keeps treats fresh and puppy can’t steal any when it is closed.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa E. Brugh

customer_reviews.title: Hard find easy on amazon great product
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t find this anywhere I need tone to train my German Shepherd I went to every pet store everyone was out but amazon had it got next day works great easy to grab treats
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is worth the money but the draw string is already pulling away but still works the price is great
customer_reviews.author: C. Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: These pouches are great to use for training or to take little treats out during walks. The material is durable and can be cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastiancanes

customer_reviews.title: I used to recommend these bags to my clients
customer_reviews.text: One of the two new bags that I bought broke today during a dog training session. The draw string broke very soon into the session. I used to recommend these bags to my clients, but I doubt I will be doing that anymore.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my fiancee and I to use for training our yellow lab puppy. They are very handy; easy to open and close, and store a good amount of treats. Cons: You'll want to wear this on a belt or a pocket though, because the clip is uncomfortable against your skin. (hence the one missing star) Pros: My lab chewed on this for about a half hour tonight before I realized what he had, and still didn't manage to chew through it or get it open.
customer_reviews.author: Karolyn R Grafton

customer_reviews.title: I really like the 2 cup tote
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both the one cup size and two cup size in this tote. I really like the 2 cup tote, as I can stash a lot of treat for my fur buddy for a long training session or walk. The clip is good, and actually stays on, unlike other bags I've tried (hence why I bought these, because I dropped my last one because of the clip!). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Great tote for tricks and treats!
customer_reviews.text: I use this pouch for every training session with my dog. I absolutely love it. I have seen other reviews about storage/cleaning issues - I put the tote with treats I inside a Ziploc bag in between training sessions to keep the treats from drying out. When it needs cleaning, the whole thing can be washed with water inside and out, then leave in the dish rack and it dries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for Obedience class. Good price, and just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: A.C.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This cup is the perfect size to hold treats for dog training. The pouch has a clip that can be attached to a pocket or around a belt, and the drawstring closure keeps the pouch opening just big enough to get two fingers in, so your treats don't get stolen!
customer_reviews.author: K. Davis

customer_reviews.title: good size, fits blue jeans pocket perfectly
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this thing is great. It has a drawstring closure that keeps treats securely inside, and the plastic belt clip, if inserted in the "coin pocket" of your jeans fits perfect -- the section that hangs past the coin pocket slips into the regular pocket, ensuring that the treat bag stays where it belongs. We use this every day, and it makes a big difference when training.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: holds the treats
customer_reviews.text: This tote neatly holds the treats and makes them easy to grab.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Krug

customer_reviews.title: Great for carrying treats on walks
customer_reviews.text: This is WAY better than the baggie of dog treats I've been shoving in my pockets. Roomy enough to easily reach in to, and it clips on the outside of a pocket or on a belt. I wish the clip was a little tighter, as it has fallen off a couple of times so I need to be aware of not losing it. It's a nice inexpensive item though, and I'm glad I bought one.
customer_reviews.author: Chinacat

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, I was worried how well the draw ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, I was worried how well the draw string would close the top to stop treats from falling out but it does a great job, completely sealing. I also think it will be easy to clean when needed. I probably could have gotten the small but it isn't a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: It’s a treat bag
customer_reviews.text: It’s a treat bag... you can fit your hand in it and it holds enough treats to make it through a day of mini training sessions with your pup.
customer_reviews.author: Mik

customer_reviews.title: I love this product but don't like not being able to choose the colors
customer_reviews.text: I use this treat bag on a daily basis. I have a service dog and a service dog in training and use positive, treat based training. However, I always have a dog with me and prefer black bags. When I attend Board meetings, professional conferences, give testimony to the Legislature, etc I prefer a black treat bag as it tends to be less obvious. Great product, can be washed in a washing machine, lasts well.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: ... probably won't last very long but it would be easy enough to put a different clip on it
customer_reviews.text: clip is cheap and probably won't last very long but it would be easy enough to put a different clip on it . would look to spend a little more for something with a sturdier clip.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: The treat tote is a sturdy material which is nice because then my pup can't ...
customer_reviews.text: The treat tote is a sturdy material which is nice because then my pup can't tear it open when he nips at it. I like the drawstring pull as well, it keeps you from spilling treats everywhere when you sit down(if you remember to use it!). One thing I was not thrilled about is the clip for your belt. The tote becomes detached pretty easily. It is easy to put back together but can get annoying to do a lot. Glue is your friend!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time! Training a 4 month old German Shepard requires treats!! This little pouch fits right on a belt loop and rides with you everywhere. Pouch has a pull shut cord that can be adjusted to allow easy access to a treat instantly. Holds plenty of treats at a time so you don't need to keep going for refills. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Fast

customer_reviews.title: Nice colors and holds the perfect amount of training snacks! The opening is a bit small though.
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 stars because my husband and kids can't stand to use these as the opening is too small. However, I find them very useful when training our puppy. Maybe my hands are smaller? However, they don't close well so be sure to put them away or your dog could easily get rewarded for finding it!
customer_reviews.author: PVR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Training
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this tote! It has a nice, large clip and the drawstring really works to keep the bag closed when you aren't using it. It was very easy to use because of its larger size - my hand could actually fit inside to grab multiple treats at a time. I wouldn't recommend the smaller size, no matter what size dog you have. It's always great to have lots of treats on hand, and this actually makes it possible. Training became fun again!
customer_reviews.author: Kimchi.S

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We use it to hold treats and a small LED flashlight (for finding night poops). This is second bag. Our dog found previous one and ate through it to get treats. Evidently it was tough as she made small hole and tongued out the treats. The fastening mechanism is light and we use electrical ties to attach it to the leash holder.
customer_reviews.author: Hinton

customer_reviews.title: i got black, what did you get?
customer_reviews.text: I'm posting a five star review because I lucked out and got a black tote in the large size just like I wanted. Lucky you, canine hardware, but be aware that I will be posting a less savory review for the small size because I got red like I did NOT want. What is with this subjective gamble, you crazy merchant. Let us pick colors.
customer_reviews.author: dimples

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is great when you don't have an extra pocket for goat treats. The clip seems sturdy enough, as that seemed to be a question. I imagine with some strong pulling it could snap, but it doesn't appear to be flimsy. The pouch is good quality and the drawstring operates as you'd want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle.

customer_reviews.title: Great Treat Tote!
customer_reviews.text: If you're training your dog and need a place to put the treats - this is the product you've been looking for! It clips to your waistband so you don't have to wear a belt and it closes to keep the treats fresh. I showed my dog trainer and she said she was going to purchase one for herself. The tote is sturdy and durable. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: I do not like the location of the clip as it is high ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a small treat bag but it is large enough for me to get my hand in it to get the treats. It is well made. I do not like the location of the clip as it is high and the treat bag hangs low on your belt or pants thus the reason for the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri A

customer_reviews.title: Awesome treat bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I my cats couldn’t break inside as they usually get into EVERYTHING! Happy to report it is cat-proof. They usually chew through cardboard, fabric, plastic but could not get through this bag. I also got this so I could do quick training with my dog on his walks and it serves its purpose as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee Zielinski

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Buy a Size up
customer_reviews.text: Do not be fooled, buy a size up. We use this for agility class and had issues with our previous bag of running out., the 2 cups is a great size for training treats (which are smaller than normal treats). Also the bag is easy to reach into and close one handed.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Meh, does its job
customer_reviews.text: It holds treats just fine but to much tightening and loosening of the draw string and it has started to fray. 6 classes done, but started to fray after the 3rd or 4th. Still works though.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product.
customer_reviews.text: A good treat bag for the price. The draw string comes in very handy and it's made of good material. Definitely get the larger size--- I got the 2 cup size but it's hard to cram 1.5 cups of treats in there. Also, I have average-size woman hands and it's hard to reach in to the bottom. It might be too small for someone with large hands.
customer_reviews.author: muddy boots

customer_reviews.title: Great! Just wish we could choose the color
customer_reviews.text: Great! Just wish we could choose the color. We have two dogs and need to be able to give them different treats (one dog has tummy issues), and now we have two in red. Other than that, the bags keep the food in and are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Your was way cheaper and is a great pouch.
customer_reviews.text: We are going through training with our terrier rescue. The trainers suggested getting a treat pouch . We went to our plocal chain store and a smaller boutique pet store that actually sold this same pouch . Your was way cheaper and is a great pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Brody

customer_reviews.title: Best treat bag for me
customer_reviews.text: I like this style bag, I find the clip great for hanging from a belt loop. I lose them, so this is the third or fourth one I have bought. [Edit:] This really is the best treat bag. Hangs from a belt loop or a pocket or a belt. Easy to jam my hand into, but with the drawstring closes tight against treat-shopping dogs when I want treats to be unavailable.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Not what i needed.
customer_reviews.text: To small for what i needed bought a different one.
customer_reviews.author: pokerfan_66

customer_reviews.title: mostly good
customer_reviews.text: This bag works well. I took a star away because the attachment clip has come loose of the treat bag itself so I actually went on a walk with no treats. But it's a nice little bag
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product for training your dogs. Clip works great and I love how the top can be closed with the draw string. Would def recommend
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Are trying it, it is functional, but I ...
customer_reviews.text: Are trying it , it is functional, but I should have purchaced one that did not use strings to close the bag. I saw one from the dog trainer, then again, that one cost a whole lot more. It came down to how much do you use it and how much do you want to pay.
customer_reviews.author: Joven

customer_reviews.title: the quality is great and I have seen at pet stores at a ...
customer_reviews.text: Get the large one, it's not too large but an appropriate size, I would assume after receiving the large one that the small one is quite small. I have a 25lbs cocker spaniel mix and he loves treats. the quality is great and I have seen at pet stores at a very costly I price.
customer_reviews.author: H Lee

customer_reviews.title: The perfect treat bag...
customer_reviews.text: This is the treat tote to get. The internal cord is not secured, but a couple of retaining stitches solved this problem. Get the 2 cup size and you won't be disappointed, it is the prefect size for a small or large dog (plus it is cheaper than the 1 cup). Only other negative is you are not able to pick your color.
customer_reviews.author: Zfoodie69

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these! I ordered iron on logos and iron them on, then hand these out to my new customers. And my customers love them too! Very happy with this product, just as described.
customer_reviews.author: Stephene

customer_reviews.title: Well-made Easy-to-Use Treat Tote
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and shape for getting a couple handfuls of treats in and individual treats back out. The clip and drawstring work great, as the description says, it can easily be done with one hand. This is also easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope D.

customer_reviews.title: It's handy to put in my waistband but like others, the drawstring slips down easily
customer_reviews.text: It's handy to put in my waistband but like others, the drawstring slips down easily. I did stitch around it to make a casing for the string but it was hard to get it close enough to the top, so it draws in about an inch down the tube. Other than that it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice treat bag
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag. It allows me to have treats handy when training -- I can get a treat out without breaking the rhythm I've got going with my dog(s). I've also clipped it to my hands-free walking belt to hold poop bags or my cell phone when taking my dogs for a walk.
customer_reviews.author: Flyfeet

customer_reviews.title: Exellent Design
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent design, you don't have to wear a belt to use this. It can just clip on to waistband of your pants or shorts. It allows you to have your hands free yet easy access to quickly grab a treat. The drawstring closure is also great and it's easy to clean. .
customer_reviews.author: lovevintagejewels

customer_reviews.title: Simple and awesome
customer_reviews.text: I previously used one of the hinged treat pouches that pops open and closed. This one is simpler but so much easier to use. It does take two hands to open and close it, but I've rarely had issues with treats falling out, and I really only need to close it up when other dogs go sniffing at the pouch. Really the only drawback is that I need pants or a belt to clip it onto - hard to use with dresses.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to access treats
customer_reviews.text: Very good pouch for dog training treats. Opening fits men as well as women's hands. Very nice pouch!
customer_reviews.author: Mary L

customer_reviews.title: Great for training!
customer_reviews.text: Great for training! When you have a puppy you NEED to get it! It's so useful! Easy to clip on. It doesn't really keep the smell out, we are using very smelly treats that work great for our puppy so I don't really mind it. I wish there will be some kind of treat bag that will keep the smells out :)
customer_reviews.author: Z. L.

customer_reviews.title: A Huge Help With Training My Puppy
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4 month old golden retriever puppy in obedience class. Between the leash, clicker, and treats, I don't have enough hands. I pop this on my belt loaded with treats and now I have one less thing to hold onto to. If you are training your dog, this is great!! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J.

customer_reviews.title: doggie treat bag
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Ordered due to recommendation of dog trainer in order to help prompt one of my dogs to go outside on walks when weather isn't so nice (rain, snow, etc). Works like a charm. Give treat when she balks and at random intervals on walk and she goes outside with no issue now. Needed large version since I have 3 dogs. Easily attaches to pants or belt.
customer_reviews.author: S. Munson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for carrying training treats!
customer_reviews.text: Love that this treat bag clips securely onto my pockets or waist band, and can easily grab treats during training sessions with my puppy. Love that I can close the bag with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Westwdbruin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The 2-cup is the perfect size for carrying treats and my car keys when we go hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Ann Van

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: The bag is sturdy. The clip helps to keep my hands free and the bag on me during our walks. I had another treat bag (different brand) that fell apart after awhile even though it wasn't being used (clip didn't hold well). Hopefully this bag will hold up better
customer_reviews.author: Nani

customer_reviews.title: this is great. I keep some poo bags in there with ...
customer_reviews.text: Basically a climber's chalk bag, this is great. I keep some poo bags in there with some treats for long walks with my dog. Stays clipped on to my belt, and if I pull the drawstring it prevents my dog from sticking his nose in there and finding his own treats.
customer_reviews.author: ASDF

customer_reviews.title: good size to use for training
customer_reviews.text: good size to use for training. Easy to reach fingers in to get treats. Clip not super strong, can pull off if not careful. Good price so I have multiple ones for different training locations. Draw string does a good job of sealing up the treats.
customer_reviews.author: luv4pets

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing! My boyfriend and I decided to hook it ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! My boyfriend and I decided to hook it onto our dog's leash and it stays in place. It has a lot of room for tons of treats and they don't fall out at all. The only thing is once you put it on a leash, you can't take it off.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Alba

product_meta.title: Chuckit Treat Tote (2 Cup)
product_meta.description: Reward good behavior on the spot with the Chuckit! Treat Tote. An ideal accessory for puppy or dog training, this clip-on treat pouch attaches easily to belt loops or pockets for training on-the-go. Featuring a drawstring closure, pet parents can easily grab treats with one hand while the other hand remains free to signal dog commands. The dog treat pouch for training holds up to 2 cups of treats and closes tightly so treats stay fresh, keeping treats in one place for daily use. Made with heavy duty pack-cloth and a rip-stop liner, the treat tote is able to withstand frequent, long-term use. The pouch fabric is also moisture resistant to protect treats from splashing or slobber. This dog treat training pouch can be discreetly tucked away for distraction-free training or filled to the top with small toys, waste bags, and more. Available in two sizes and assorted colors, pet parents can choose a treat tote that best suits their pets' needs.
feature_bullets: TREAT-TRAINING TOOL: Clip-on dog treat pouch allows pet parents to quickly reward good behavior on the spot by attaching to belt or pocket
EASY-OPEN POUCH: Drawstring closure is easy to open with one hand for quick access to dog treats
TREAT STORAGE: Holds 2 cups of dogs' favorite treats and seals via drawstring closure to ensure freshness
HEAVY-DUTY MATERIAL: Durable pack-cloth dog treat bag is water-resistant to keep treats dry and reinforced with a rip-stop liner for lasting quality
HOLDS MORE THAN TREATS: Clip-on dog training pouch is ideal for stowing small toys or waste bags in addition to small training treats
DISTRACTION-FREE TRAINING: Clip-on treat tote is small and discreet to keep dogs focused on playtime or training
AVAILABLE IN VARIOUS SIZES: Treat bag comes in two sizes, allowing pet parents to choose a size that best suits their pets' needs
